title: Yanchen Jiang (Jeff Jiang)
text:
Hello! My name is Yanchen Jiang (I also use the name Jeff Jiang).
I’m a third year Computer Science PhD candidate at Harvard University, advised by Professor David C. Parkes and Professor Yiling Chen. My research interests lies at the intersection of computer science and economics, focusing on mechanism design, incentives, and decision-making. I employ computational frameworks to tackle established problems in economics and mechanism design, and I integrate considerations of incentives, human behavior, game theory, and multi-agent interactions into large language models (LLMs) and generative AI, to enhance their applicability in complex economic environments.
I obtained my Bachelor’s degree from Harvard College in 2022, with a major (joint concentration) in Computer Science and Mathematics and a minor (secondary) in Statistics.
I have been the Head TA of Harvard’s CS136: Economics and Computation in Fall 2023, and a TA for the same course (CS136) in Fall 2021.
You can find more information about current projects I’m working on and prior academic publications on the Publications & Projects page and my contact information. For more information, you can find my CV here.

title: Contact Information
text:

title: Publications & Projects
text:
Academic Publications
* indicates equal contribution, (\(\alpha\)-\(\beta\)) indicates alphabetical author order.

Selected Conference Publications:
1. BundleFlow: Deep Menus for Combinatorial Auctions by Diffusion-Based Optimization  Tonghan Wang, Yanchen Jiang, David C. Parkes.  Accepted, NeurIPS 2025 Preprint.
2. GemNet: Menu-Based, Strategy-Proof Multi-Bidder Auctions Through Deep Learning  Tonghan Wang*, Yanchen Jiang* , David C. Parkes. The Twenty-Fifth ACM Conference on Economics and Computation (EC’24), Publication, Preprint.  Won Exemplary Paper Award (awarded to the top paper in track) for the AI track, presented at the Best EC 24 papers plenary session.
3. Data Market Design through Deep Learning  Sai Srivatsa Ravindranath*, Yanchen Jiang* , David C. Parkes. Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 36 (NeurIPS 2023). Publication, Preprint.


Other Conference Publications:
1. On Diffusion Models for Multi-Agent Partial Observability: Shared Attractors, Error Bounds, and Composite Flow  Tonghan Wang*, Heng Dong*, Yanchen Jiang, David C. Parkes, Milind Tambe. 24th International Conference on Autonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems (AAMAS 2025), Preprint.


Workshop and Exhibition Papers:
1. Charting the Shapes of Stories with Game Theory  (\(\alpha\)-\(\beta\)) Constantinos Daskalakis, Ian Gemp, Yanchen Jiang, Renato Paes Leme, Christos Papadimitriou, Georgios Piliouras. Preprint, NeurIPS 2024 Creative AI.
2. Evidence from the Synthetic Laboratory: Language Models as Auction Participants Anand Shah*, Kehang Zhu*, Yanchen Jiang, Kerem Dayi, Jeffery Wang, John J. Horton, David C. Parkes.  EC’24 contributed poster session; NeurIPS 2024 Workshop on Behavioral Machine Learning. Preprint.


Preprints and Working Papers:
1. Incentive-Aligned Multi-Source LLM Summaries  Yanchen Jiang, Zhe Feng, Aranyak Mehta.  arXiv Preprint.
2. LLM-Powered Preference Elicitation in Combinatorial Assignment  Ermis Soumalias*, Yanchen Jiang*, Kehang Zhu*, Michael Curry, Sven Seuken, David C. Parkes.  arXiv Preprint.


Survey Papers and Research Letters:
1. Automated Mechanism Design: A Survey  Michael J. Curry, Zhou Fan, Yanchen Jiang, Sai Srivatsa Ravindranath, Tonghan Wang, David C. Parkes.  ACM SIGecom Exchanges, volume 22, issue 2, March 2025. Publication.
